snippet: In May, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo anticipated that it would be done “in the next several weeks,” and last month, he said he expected it to be done before next year’s state election.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces that he does not have a timeline for the release of results of study evaluating health risks of hydraulic fracturing process of drilling for natural gas; says that although study has been underway for 15 months, he does not want to pressure New York State Health Commissioner Nirav R Shah, into artificially abbreviating such an important health-risk study.
lead_paragraph: In May, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo anticipated that it would be done “in the next several weeks,” and last month, he said he expected it to be done before next year’s state election.

headline.main: Still Undecided on Fracking, Cuomo Won’t Press for Health Study’s Release
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Says He Can Wait For a Report On Fracking
